info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 7 at 4:14PM EDT until June 7 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Caribou ME
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of DownEast Maine, including the following counties, far northeastern Hancock and Washington.
* WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 413 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen on saturated ground from rain that fell yesterday. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vanceboro, Princeton, Topsfield, Grand Lake Stream, Codyville Plantation, Fowler Township, Dyer Township, Baileyville, Alexander, Crawford, Waite, Beddington, Codyville, Big Lake, Brookton, Fowler, Dyer, Forest, Lambert Lake and Nicatous Lake. - For flood safety visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING
